Chefs are responsible for developing recipes, managing kitchen operations, and overseeing the preparation and presentation of food in various dining establishments.

recipes.recipe_description: This classic pasta dish features a creamy egg sauce with crispy bacon and Parmesan cheese.
cooking_method: Cook the spaghetti according to the package instructions.
In a separate pan, cook the bacon until crispy and set aside.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs and Parmesan cheese.
Drain the cooked spaghetti and add it to the pan with the bacon.
Remove from heat and add the egg mixture, stirring quickly to avoid scrambling the eggs.
Season with black pepper and serve immediately.

Season with black pepper and serve immediately.

recipes.recipe_description: This simple yet flavorful roasted chicken is perfect for a cozy Sunday dinner.
cooking_method: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
In a small bowl, mix together softened butter, minced garlic, chopped rosemary, and the juice and zest of one lemon.
Remove the chicken giblets and rinse the chicken inside and out. Pat the chicken dry with paper towels.
Rub the butter mixture all over the chicken, including under the skin.
Season the chicken with salt and black pepper.
Roast the chicken in the preheated oven for 1 hour and 30 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F.
Let the chicken rest for 10 minutes before carving and serving.

recipes.recipe_description: This British classic features tender beef filet wrapped in puff pastry.
cooking_method: Season the beef filet with salt and black pepper.
In a hot pan, sear the beef filet on all sides until browned.
Season the chicken with salt and black pepper.
Roast the chicken in the preheated oven for 1 hour and 30 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F.
Let the chicken rest for 10 minutes before carving and serving.
